seg-source.mrk: Starting the Network Server

target.mrk: Starting the Network Server

trans-unit.source: To start the Network Server, you can invoke a script, a jar file, or a class.

target.mrk: To start the Network Server, you can invoke a script, a jar file, or a class.

trans-unit.source: Always shut down the Network Server properly after use, because failure to do so might result in unpredictable side effects, such as blocked ports on the server.

seg-source.mrk: Always shut down the Network Server properly after use, because failure to do so might result in unpredictable side effects, such as blocked ports on the server.

target.mrk: Always shut down the Network Server properly after use, because failure to do so might result in unpredictable side effects, such as blocked ports on the server.

trans-unit.source: You are strongly urged to enable user authentication and user authorization when you run a Network Server. For details on how to configure user authentication, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>. For information on user authorization, see "Users and authorization identifiers" and "User authorizations" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>. You are also urged to install a Java security manager with a customized security policy. For details on how to do this, see <xref href="tadminnetservcustom.dita#tadminnetservcustom"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: You are strongly urged to enable user authentication and user authorization when you run a Network Server.
For details on how to configure user authentication, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
For information on user authorization, see "Users and authorization identifiers" and "User authorizations" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
You are also urged to install a Java security manager with a customized security policy.
For details on how to do this, see <xref href="tadminnetservcustom.dita#tadminnetservcustom"></xref>.

target.mrk: You are strongly urged to enable user authentication and user authorization when you run a Network Server.
For details on how to configure user authentication, see "Working with user authentication" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
For information on user authorization, see "Users and authorization identifiers" and "User authorizations" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
You are also urged to install a Java security manager with a customized security policy.
For details on how to do this, see <xref href="tadminnetservcustom.dita#tadminnetservcustom"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: If you are running Java SE 7 or later, and if you start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server from the command line as described here, access to databases and to other <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> files is by default restricted to the operating system account that started the Network Server. It is possible to override this default behavior. For more information, see <xref href="cadminnetservfileperms.dita#cadminnetservfileperms"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: If you are running Java SE 7 or later, and if you start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server from the command line as described here, access to databases and to other <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> files is by default restricted to the operating system account that started the Network Server.
It is possible to override this default behavior.
For more information, see <xref href="cadminnetservfileperms.dita#cadminnetservfileperms"></xref>.

target.mrk: If you are running Java SE 7 or later, and if you start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server from the command line as described here, access to databases and to other <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> files is by default restricted to the operating system account that started the Network Server.
It is possible to override this default behavior.
For more information, see <xref href="cadminnetservfileperms.dita#cadminnetservfileperms"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: You can start the Network Server in any of the following ways:

seg-source.mrk: You can start the Network Server in any of the following ways:

target.mrk: You can start the Network Server in any of the following ways:

trans-unit.source: If you are relatively new to the Java programming language, follow the instructions in "Setting up your environment" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citgetstart"></ph> to set the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> and <codeph>JAVA_HOME</codeph> environment variables and to add <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph> to your path. Then use the <codeph>startNetworkServer.bat</codeph> script to start the Network Server on Windows machines and the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> script to start the Network Server on UNIX systems. These scripts are located in <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph>, where <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> is the directory where you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: If you are relatively new to the Java programming language, follow the instructions in "Setting up your environment" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citgetstart"></ph> to set the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> and <codeph>JAVA_HOME</codeph> environment variables and to add <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph> to your path.

Then use the <codeph>startNetworkServer.bat</codeph> script to start the Network Server on Windows machines and the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> script to start the Network Server on UNIX systems.

These scripts are located in <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph>, where <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> is the directory where you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

target.mrk: If you are relatively new to the Java programming language, follow the instructions in "Setting up your environment" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citgetstart"></ph> to set the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> and <codeph>JAVA_HOME</codeph> environment variables and to add <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph> to your path.

Then use the <codeph>startNetworkServer.bat</codeph> script to start the Network Server on Windows machines and the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> script to start the Network Server on UNIX systems.

These scripts are located in <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph>/bin</codeph>, where <codeph>$<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> is the directory where you installed <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: You can run NetworkServerControl commands only from the host that started the Network Server. The following table shows the sequence of commands.

seg-source.mrk: You can run NetworkServerControl commands only from the host that started the Network Server.
The following table shows the sequence of commands.

target.mrk: You can run NetworkServerControl commands only from the host that started the Network Server.
The following table shows the sequence of commands.

seg-source.mrk: Commands to run the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> command

target.mrk: Commands to run the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> command

trans-unit.source: This table lists the commands to run the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> command on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the commands to run the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> command on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table lists the commands to run the <codeph>startNetworkServer</codeph> command on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: Operating System

target.mrk: Operating System

seg-source.mrk: Command

target.mrk: Command

seg-source.mrk: Windows

target.mrk: Windows

seg-source.mrk: set DERBY_HOME=C:\derby set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24 set PATH=%DERBY_HOME%\bin;%PATH% startNetworkServer

target.mrk: set DERBY_HOME=C:\derby set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24 set PATH=%DERBY_HOME%\bin;%PATH% startNetworkServer

seg-source.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

target.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

seg-source.mrk: export DERBY_HOME=/opt/derby export JAVA_HOME=/usr/j2se export PATH="$DERBY_HOME/bin:$PATH" startNetworkServer

target.mrk: export DERBY_HOME=/opt/derby export JAVA_HOME=/usr/j2se export PATH="$DERBY_HOME/bin:$PATH" startNetworkServer

trans-unit.source: If you are a regular Java user but are new to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, set the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> environment variable, then use a <codeph>java</codeph> command to invoke the <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> or <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> file, as shown in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: If you are a regular Java user but are new to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, set the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> environment variable, then use a <codeph>java</codeph> command to invoke the <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> or <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> file, as shown in the following table.

target.mrk: If you are a regular Java user but are new to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, set the <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph> environment variable, then use a <codeph>java</codeph> command to invoke the <codeph>derbyrun.jar</codeph> or <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> file, as shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Commands to invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files

seg-source.mrk: Commands to invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files

target.mrk: Commands to invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files

trans-unit.source: This table lists the commands to invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the commands to invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table lists the commands to invoke the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: Operating System

target.mrk: Operating System

seg-source.mrk: Command

target.mrk: Command

seg-source.mrk: Windows

target.mrk: Windows

seg-source.mrk: set DERBY_HOME=C:\derby java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbyrun.jar server start or java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbynet.jar start

target.mrk: set DERBY_HOME=C:\derby java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbyrun.jar server start or java -jar %DERBY_HOME%\lib\derbynet.jar start

seg-source.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

target.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

seg-source.mrk: export DERBY_HOME=/opt/derby java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbyrun.jar server start or java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbynet.jar start

target.mrk: export DERBY_HOME=/opt/derby java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbyrun.jar server start or java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbynet.jar start

trans-unit.source: To see the command syntax, invoke <codeph>derbyrun.jar server</codeph> or <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> with no arguments.

seg-source.mrk: To see the command syntax, invoke <codeph>derbyrun.jar server</codeph> or <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> with no arguments.

target.mrk: To see the command syntax, invoke <codeph>derbyrun.jar server</codeph> or <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph> with no arguments.

trans-unit.source: If you are familiar with both the Java programming language and <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, you have already set <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph>. Set your classpath to include the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files. Then use a <codeph>java</codeph> command to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class directly, as shown in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: If you are familiar with both the Java programming language and <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, you have already set <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph>.
Set your classpath to include the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files.
Then use a <codeph>java</codeph> command to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class directly, as shown in the following table.

target.mrk: If you are familiar with both the Java programming language and <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, you have already set <codeph><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph></codeph>.
Set your classpath to include the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> jar files.
Then use a <codeph>java</codeph> command to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class directly, as shown in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Commands to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class

target.mrk: Commands to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class

trans-unit.source: This table lists the commands to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the commands to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table lists the commands to invoke the <codeph>NetworkServerControl</codeph> class on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: Operating System

target.mrk: Operating System

seg-source.mrk: Command

target.mrk: Command

seg-source.mrk: Windows

target.mrk: Windows

seg-source.mrk: %DERBY_HOME%\bin\setNetworkServerCP java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start

target.mrk: %DERBY_HOME%\bin\setNetworkServerCP java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start

seg-source.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

target.mrk: UNIX (Korn Shell)

seg-source.mrk: $DERBY_HOME/bin/setNetworkServerCP java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start

target.mrk: $DERBY_HOME/bin/setNetworkServerCP java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start

trans-unit.source: The default system directory is the directory in which <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> was started. (See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about the default system directory.)

seg-source.mrk: The default system directory is the directory in which <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> was started.
(See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about the default system directory.)

target.mrk: The default system directory is the directory in which <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> was started.
(See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information about the default system directory.)

trans-unit.source: You can specify a different host or port number when you start the Network Server by specifying an option to the command.

seg-source.mrk: You can specify a different host or port number when you start the Network Server by specifying an option to the command.

target.mrk: You can specify a different host or port number when you start the Network Server by specifying an option to the command.

trans-unit.source: Specify a port number other than the default (1527) by using the <codeph>-p <varname>portnumber</varname></codeph> option, as shown in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: Specify a port number other than the default (1527) by using the <codeph>-p <varname>portnumber</varname></codeph> option, as shown in the following example:

target.mrk: Specify a port number other than the default (1527) by using the <codeph>-p <varname>portnumber</varname></codeph> option, as shown in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start -p 1368

target.mrk: java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start -p 1368

trans-unit.source: Specify a specific interface (host name or IP address) to listen on other than the default (<codeph>localhost</codeph>) by using the <codeph>-h</codeph> option, as shown in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: Specify a specific interface (host name or IP address) to listen on other than the default (<codeph>localhost</codeph>) by using the <codeph>-h</codeph> option, as shown in the following example:

target.mrk: Specify a specific interface (host name or IP address) to listen on other than the default (<codeph>localhost</codeph>) by using the <codeph>-h</codeph> option, as shown in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: $DERBY_HOME/bin/startNetworkServer -h myhost -p 1368

target.mrk: $DERBY_HOME/bin/startNetworkServer -h myhost -p 1368

trans-unit.source: where <varname>myhost</varname> is the host name or IP address.

seg-source.mrk: where <varname>myhost</varname> is the host name or IP address.

target.mrk: where <varname>myhost</varname> is the host name or IP address.

trans-unit.source: Before using the <codeph>-h</codeph> option, you should run under the Java security manager with a customized security policy and you should enable user authentication.

seg-source.mrk: Before using the <codeph>-h</codeph> option, you should run under the Java security manager with a customized security policy and you should enable user authentication.

target.mrk: Before using the <codeph>-h</codeph> option, you should run under the Java security manager with a customized security policy and you should enable user authentication.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Network Server will listen to requests only on the loopback address, which means that it will only accept connections from the local host.

seg-source.mrk: By default, the Network Server will listen to requests only on the loopback address, which means that it will only accept connections from the local host.

target.mrk: By default, the Network Server will listen to requests only on the loopback address, which means that it will only accept connections from the local host.
